name: Department of Public Enterprises
notes: Primary shareholder representative for all 4 SOEs. Oversees governance, performance and strategic direction.

engagements.outcome: Performance contracts reviewed. Denel turnaround commended. Transnet port issues escalated.
Load shedding end briefing. Eskom debt relief progress confirmed.

name: National Treasury
notes: Controls SOE guarantees and bailouts. Manages R254bn Eskom debt relief. Monitors all fiscal transfers to SOEs.

engagements.outcome: SOE fiscal risk assessment conducted. Eskom improving. SAA watch list maintained.
Eskom FY2024 debt relief tranche of R84bn confirmed in Budget Speech.

name: NERSA - National Energy Regulator of South Africa
notes: Regulates Eskom electricity tariffs (MYPD). Issues generation, transmission and distribution licences. Key stakeholder for all Eskom proceedings.

engagements.outcome: 18.65% tariff increase approved for FY2024/25. Public participation process concluded.
Eskom submitted MYPD6 application. NERSA public hearings scheduled for Q1 2025.

name: Auditor-General of South Africa (AGSA)
notes: Constitutional body auditing all SOEs. Issues qualified opinions for Eskom and SAA. Monitors irregular and wasteful expenditure.

engagements.outcome: Eskom FY2024 audit: unqualified opinion - first in years. Eskom commended on financial management improvements.

name: NUM - National Union of Mineworkers
notes: Represents majority of Eskom and Denel workers. Key partner in annual wage negotiations. Historically militant on retrenchments.

engagements.outcome: Eskom wage agreement concluded at 7% increase, 3-year deal. NUM members to vote by end April.

name: SATAWU - South African Transport and Allied Workers Union
notes: Largest union at Transnet and SAA. Led 2022 Transnet strike. Represents drivers, crane operators and port workers.

engagements.outcome: CCMA facilitated settlement at 7.5% increase. Strike ended after 11 days with R2.4bn revenue loss.
Transnet wage discussions opened. SATAWU seeking 12% increase. Management counter at 6%.

name: NUMSA - National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
notes: Key union at Denel and SAA. Represents engineers and technicians. Active in Denel salary arrears dispute and SAA business rescue process.

engagements.outcome: NUMSA agreed to 6-month payment plan for Denel salary arrears subject to government guarantee.

name: UASA - United Association of South Africa
notes: Represents professional and management staff at Eskom and Denel. Key partner in skills retention discussions.

engagements.outcome: Eskom wage agreement concluded for management grades.

name: Solidarity Trade Union
notes: Represents technical and artisan staff mainly at Eskom and Denel. Participates in annual wage negotiations.

engagements.outcome: Solidarity signed Eskom 3-year wage deal at 7% per annum.

name: Public Investment Corporation (PIC)
notes: Holds bonds and quasi-equity in Transnet and Eskom. Manages GEPF assets. Key lender to SOEs via government-guaranteed bonds.

engagements.outcome: Transnet recovery plan positively received. PIC confirmed rollover of R12bn in maturing bonds.

name: DBSA - Development Bank of Southern Africa
notes: Major lender to Eskom and Transnet for infrastructure projects. Facilitates green finance for Eskom renewable transition.

engagements.outcome: DBSA approved R8bn green bond facility for Eskom renewable energy connections.

name: IDC - Industrial Development Corporation
notes: Provides financing for Denel expansion projects and SAA business plan funding.

engagements.outcome: IDC approved R1.5bn facility for Denel manufacturing expansion linked to Rooivalk contract.

name: South African Civil Aviation Authority (SACAA)
notes: Regulates SAA's Air Operator Certificate (AOC). Issues and renews licences. Conducts safety oversight audits.

engagements.outcome: IOSA renewal completed successfully. AOC confirmed valid to July 2026.

name: Department of Transport and Logistics
notes: Policy authority for ports, rail and aviation. Key engagement on Transnet third-party access and port tariff regulation.

engagements.outcome: Port Economic Regulator consultation on Transnet port tariffs. Third party access framework discussed.

name: Armscor - Armaments Corporation of South Africa
notes: Primary customer for Denel products on behalf of SANDF. Manages all SANDF procurement. Key in Denel order book.

engagements.outcome: Ammunition supply contract extended. Rooivalk delivery schedule agreed with 4-month contingency.

name: South African National Defence Force (SANDF)
notes: End user of Denel products including ammunition, armoured vehicles and Rooivalk helicopters.

engagements.outcome: Q3 ammunition delivery accepted. Rooivalk delay formally noted with penalty clause review initiated.

name: Exxaro Resources
notes: Major coal supplier to Eskom's power stations, particularly Matimba and Medupi. Multi-year supply agreements.

engagements.outcome: 10-year coal supply agreement extended. Price escalation formula agreed in line with CPI.

name: Thungela Resources
notes: Supplies coal to KwaZulu-Natal power stations including Duvha and Arnot. Subject to BEE procurement guidelines.

engagements.outcome: Delivery shortfalls in Q1 2024 resolved. Additional trains committed from Ermelo colliery.

name: Parliamentary Portfolio Committee on Public Enterprises
notes: Constitutional oversight of SOEs. CEOs and boards appear before committee. Tabling of annual reports.

engagements.outcome: Transnet Recovery Plan progress reviewed. Committee satisfied with Eskom improvement. SAA fleet update requested.

name: Mr Pravin Gordhan
notes: Former minister overseeing SOE restructuring 2018-2024. Drove Eskom debt relief, SAA rescue and Transnet NDP.

name: Dr Kgosientsho Ramokgopa
notes: Minister responsible for Eskom and energy policy. Oversees end of load shedding programme and Just Energy Transition.

engagements.outcome: Minister declared end of load shedding. Weekly Eskom CEO briefings established.

name: Eskom Employee Pension Fund Board
notes: Manages R160bn pension fund for Eskom employees. Board composition includes union nominees. Key on post-retirement obligations.

engagements.outcome: EPPF confirmed fully funded status with 104% funded ratio.

name: Competition Commission of South Africa
notes: Investigates anti-competitive behaviour. Engaged on Transnet third-party rail access and Eskom electricity market reform.

engagements.outcome: Competition Commission market study on electricity sector recommends faster IPP access to grid.

name: IATA - International Air Transport Association
notes: Governs IOSA safety certification for SAA. Provides slot coordination and interline billing services.

engagements.outcome: SAA IOSA registration renewed. Valid from August 2024 to August 2026.

name: Business Unity South Africa (BUSA)
notes: Advocates for business interests on SOE performance. Key voice on electricity costs and port logistics affecting competitiveness.

engagements.outcome: BUSA presented impact of load shedding on GDP. R56bn annual economic cost quantified. Eskom improvement welcomed.

name: South African Revenue Service (SARS)
notes: Tax compliance requirements for all SOEs. Eskom has R12bn in deferred tax positions. Custom oversight on Transnet imports.

engagements.outcome: All SOEs confirm current tax compliance. Transnet customs duty dispute resolved.

name: World Bank Group
notes: Provides technical assistance and financing for Eskom Just Energy Transition. Co-financed with DBSA.

engagements.outcome: World Bank approved $500m technical assistance for Eskom coal mine worker transition programme.

name: Port Economic Regulator
notes: Regulates Transnet National Ports Authority tariffs. Annual tariff applications reviewed. Key engagement for port reform discussions.

engagements.outcome: Transnet TNPA tariff application for FY2025 submitted. 10.5% increase requested.
